verses.text: 你們應該效法我，好像我效法基督一樣。

words.note: Often used in moral or religious contexts
Often used in moral or religious contexts

verses.text: 我稱讚你們，因為你們在一切事上都記念我，又持守我傳交給你們的教訓。

words.note: Used with '在...事' to mean 'in matters'

verses.heading: Women’s Head Coverings

verses.text: 但是我願意你們知道，基督是男人的頭，男人是女人的頭（「男人是女人的頭」或譯：「丈夫是妻子的頭」）， 神是基督的頭。
男人禱告或講道的時候，如果蒙著頭，就是羞辱自己的頭。

words.note: Used in 'verb + 的時候' construction
'著' indicates ongoing action or state

verses.text: 女人禱告或講道的時候，如果不蒙著頭，就是羞辱自己的頭，因為這就好像剃了頭髮一樣。

words.note: Used in 'verb + 的時候' construction
'著' indicates ongoing action or state

verses.text: 女人要不蒙著頭，她就應當把頭髮剪了；如果女人以為剪髮或剃頭是羞恥的事，她就應當蒙著頭。

words.note: Here functions as a conditional 'if'.
Introduces object of verb, often implying disposal or impact.

verses.text: 男人不應蒙著頭，因為他是 神的形象和榮耀，而女人是男人的榮耀。

words.note: Short for '應當'.
The space is a respectful traditional rendering for God.

verses.text: 因為男人不是由女人而出，女人卻是由男人而出，

words.note: Often used in the structure '由...而出' (to come from...).
Often used in the structure '由...而出' (to come from...).

verses.text: 並且男人不是為了女人而造的，女人卻是為了男人而造的。

words.note: Connects clauses, often showing cause/purpose.
Used here to form a passive or descriptive clause '...而造的' (that was made).
Connects clauses, often showing cause/purpose.
Used here to form a passive or descriptive clause '...而造的' (that was made).

verses.text: 因此，為天使的緣故，女人應當在頭上有服權柄的記號。

words.note: Lit. 'heavenly messenger'.

verses.text: 然而在主裡面，女人不可以沒有男人，男人也不可以沒有女人。
因為正如女人是由男人而出，照樣，男人是藉著女人而生；萬有都是出於 神。

words.note: Connects verbs/phrases, indicating consequence or progression.
Connects verbs/phrases, indicating consequence or progression.

verses.text: 你們自己判斷一下，女人向 神禱告的時候不蒙頭，是合適的嗎？

words.note: Indicates a brief, casual, or tentative action.
V-O compound meaning 'to pray'.
Here, it forms an adverbial phrase 'when praying to God'.
Refers specifically to head covering in a religious context.

verses.text: 人的本性不是也教導你們，如果男人有長頭髮，就是他的羞恥嗎？

words.note: Emphasizes a consequence or outcome.

verses.text: 如果女人有長頭髮，不就是她的榮耀嗎？因為頭髮是給她作蓋頭的。

words.note: Emphasizes a consequence or outcome.
Specifically refers to a head covering in a religious context.
Emphasizes the nature or purpose.

verses.text: 如果有人想要強辯，我們卻沒有這種習慣， 神的眾教會也沒有。

words.definition: to want to, to wish to

verses.text: 我現在要吩咐你們，不是要稱讚你們，因為你們聚集在一起，並沒有得到益處，反而有害處。

words.definition: to want to, to intend to
and, furthermore; (used with negative) emphatically not

verses.heading: The Lord’s Supper

verses.text: 首先，我聽說你們在聚會的時候，你們中間起了分裂，這話我也稍微相信。
你們中間會有分黨結派的事，這是必然的，為的是要使那些經得起考驗的人顯明出來。

words.note: Describes forming exclusive groups or parties.

words.definition: in order to, for the purpose of
to want to, to intend to

verses.text: 你們聚集在一起，不是吃主的晚餐，
因為吃的時候，各人都先吃自己的晚餐，結果有人飢餓，有人醉了。
難道你們沒有家可以吃喝嗎？還是你們藐視 神的教會，使那些沒有的羞愧呢？我向你們可以說甚麼呢？稱讚你們嗎？在這事上我不能稱讚。

words.note: Used to express rhetorical question.
Refers to the Christian God. Often capitalized.
Combined with '在...上' often means 'in/on (this matter)'.

verses.text: 我當日傳交給你們的，原是從主領受的，就是主耶穌被出賣的那一夜，他拿起餅來，

words.note: Common in historical or biblical narratives.
Here, refers to passing on tradition or teaching.
Often implies spiritual or formal reception.
Commonly used for betrayal in biblical contexts.

verses.text: 祝謝了，就擘開，說：「這是我的身體，為你們擘開的；你們應當這樣行，為的是記念我。」

words.note: Specifically refers to giving thanks/blessing before a meal/sacrifice.
Specifically refers to breaking bread, often ritually.

words.definition: in order to, for the purpose of

words.note: In biblical context, often refers to ritual remembrance.

verses.text: 飯後，照樣拿起杯來，說：「這杯是用我的血所立的新約，你們每逢喝的時候，應當這樣行，為的是記念我。」

words.note: The particle '所' forms a passive or specifies agent/means.

words.definition: in order to, for the purpose of

verses.text: 你們每逢吃這餅，喝這杯，就是宣揚主的死，直等到他來。

words.note: More formal than simply 'say' or 'tell'.
Means 'straight until' or 'wait until'.

verses.text: 因此，無論甚麼人若用不合適的態度吃主的餅，喝主的杯，就是得罪主的身體、主的血了。

words.note: More formal or literary than '如果'.
Refers to sinning against God or violating moral principles.

verses.text: 所以人應當省察自己，然後才吃這餅，喝這杯。

words.note: More formal than just 'think about'.

verses.text: 因為那吃喝的人，如果不辨明是主的身體，就是吃喝定在自己的身上的罪了。

words.note: To clearly differentiate or understand something's true nature.
Here implies incurring or bringing a consequence upon oneself.

verses.text: 因此，你們中間有許多人是軟弱的，患病的，而且死了（「死了」直譯作「睡了」）的也不少。

words.note: Often used in a spiritual or moral sense in biblical contexts.
More formal than 生病 (shēngbìng).
Here, it nominalizes the preceding phrase, referring to 'those who have died'.

verses.text: 我們若仔細省察自己，就不會受審判了。

words.note: Can be noun 'judgment' or verb 'to judge'.

verses.text: 然而我們被主審判的時候，是受他的管教，免得和世人一同被定罪。

words.note: Can be verb 'to judge' or noun 'judgment'.
Can be noun 'discipline' or verb 'to discipline'.
Often refers to people outside the faith in religious contexts.

verses.text: 所以，我的弟兄們，你們聚集在一起吃的時候，要彼此等待。

words.note: Commonly used for fellow believers in the Bible.

verses.text: 如果有人餓了，就應當在家裡先吃，免得你們聚集在一起的時候受到審判。其餘的事，我來的時候再作安排。

words.note: Can be noun 'judgment' or verb 'to judge'.
Can be verb 'to arrange' or noun 'arrangement'.
